thread.section_title: Arts and Entertainment coverage for all ages and interests - San Francisco Chronicle
thread.title: Boxed in by comedy of life in ‘Object Lesson’
thread.title_full: Boxed in by comedy of life in ‘Object Lesson’ - San Francisco Chronicle

author: Robert Hurwitt
title: Boxed in by comedy of life in ‘Object Lesson’
text:
Photo: Jim Norrena The audience sits on boxes on the stage as Geoff Sobelle performs “The Object Lesson” in the Curran: Under Construction series. The audience sits on boxes on the stage as Geoff Sobelle performs...
The first thing you need to know about Geoff Sobelle’s intriguing “The Object Lesson,” the current show in the exciting Curran: Under Construction series, is that it’s a good idea to arrive about 20 minutes early. That’s your chance to get to know Sobelle’s co-performer in the clown show-cum-performance installation that opened Wednesday, Oct. 14 — the abandoned warehouse-like installation that houses both performance and audience. The audience sits on boxes on the stage as Geoff Sobelle performs “The Object Lesson” in the Curran: Under Construction series. The audience sits on boxes on the stage as Geoff Sobelle performs...
